00022 #include "chipstream/ProbeListFactory.h"
00023 //
00024 #include <cassert>
00025 //
00026 
00027 #define print_sizeof(x) printf("== sizeof(%s)=%lu\n",#x,sizeof(x))
00028 #define STRORNULL(x) ((x==NULL)?"(null)":x)
00029 
00030 int
00031 main(int argc,char* argv[])
00032 {
00033   //print_sizeof(ProbeList_Original);
00034   //
00035   print_sizeof(ProbeList_E_Probe);
00036   print_sizeof(ProbeList_E_Block);
00037   print_sizeof(ProbeList_Head);
00038   print_sizeof(ProbeList);
00039 
00040   // here we just alloc some bytes and print the pointers
00041 
00042   // size of the test
00043   int test_size=4;
00044 
00045   // malloc will round to 16b
00046   if (0) {
00047     for (int i=0;i<10;i++) {
00048       char* ptr=(char*)malloc(test_size);
00049       printf("malloc(%d)=%p\n",test_size,ptr);
00050     }
00051   }
00052 
00053   // ProbeList heap does not.
00054   // make the heap
00055   ProbeListFactory pl_factory;
00056   ProbeListPacked plist;
00057 
00058   // try changing size of the regions to see what happens.
00059   //pl_heap.set_default_region_size(1024*1024); // big
00060   //pl_heap.set_default_region_size(1024); // small
00061   //pl_heap.set_default_region_size(10);  // tiny
00062 
00063   pl_factory.dump_regions();
00064 
00065   // and get some byte pointers
00066   printf("== byte ptr test:\n");
00067   for (int i=0;i<10;i++) {
00068     char* ptr=pl_factory.alloc_ProbeList_bytes(test_size);
00069     printf("  heap_allooc(%d)=%p\n",test_size,ptr);
00070   }
00071 
00072   pl_factory.dump_regions();
00073   pl_factory.clear();
00074   pl_factory.dump_regions();
00075 
00076   for (int i=0;i<10000;i++) {
00077     pl_factory.alloc_ProbeList_bytes(100);
00078     pl_factory.alloc_ProbeList_bytes(50);
00079   }
00080 
00081   pl_factory.dump_regions();
00082   pl_factory.clear();
00083   pl_factory.dump_regions();
00084 
00085   // alloc some zero
00086   printf("== name length test:\n");
00087   for (int i=0;i<2;i++) {
00088     //
00089     plist=pl_factory.add_ProbeList(0,0,0);
00090     plist.set_name("abc");
00091     printf("  plist: addr=%p name='%s'\n",plist.m_headptr,STRORNULL(plist.get_name_cstr()));
00092     //
00093     plist=pl_factory.add_ProbeList(0,0,1);
00094     plist.set_name("def");
00095     printf("  plist: addr=%p name='%s'\n",plist.m_headptr,STRORNULL(plist.get_name_cstr()));
00096     //
00097     plist=pl_factory.add_ProbeList(0,0,2);
00098     plist.set_name("ghi");
00099     printf("  plist: addr=%p name='%s'\n",plist.m_headptr,STRORNULL(plist.get_name_cstr()));
00100   }
00101 
00102   printf("== heap clear test:\n");
00103   // use the heap 4 times, clearing at the end.
00104   // note the reuse of addresses after the first time.
00105   // (clearing of the allocations above this loop.)
00106   for (int x=0;x<10;x++) {
00107     // now generate some ProbeLists
00108     for (int i=0;i<100;i++) {
00109       //ProbeList plist=pl_factory.new_ProbeList(i,4,"foo123");
00110       plist=pl_factory.add_ProbeList(2,4,"foo123");
00111       if ((x<3)&&(i<5)) {
00112         printf("  plist: addr=%p name=%s\n",plist.m_headptr,STRORNULL(plist.get_name_cstr()));
00113       }
00114       // put some data in
00115       for (int b=0;b<plist.block_cnt();b++) {
00116         plist.set_blockSize(b,b);
00117       }
00118       for (int p=0;p<plist.probe_cnt();p++) {
00119         plist.set_probeId(p,p);
00120       }
00121     }
00122     pl_factory.clear();
00123   }
00124   pl_factory.delete_regions();
00125 
00126   return 0;
00127 }
